Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    A GUI written in Java Swing which wraps around a Game instance. Is used to get a graphical view of the data in a Game.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nikolaj Ignatieff Schwartzbach

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int HEIGHT
      Width and height of the inner window, in pixels
      static City hover
      Reference to the City which is currently under the mouse
      static int speed
      The current game speed (0 = stop, 1 = slow, .. )
      int WIDTH
      Width and height of the inner window, in pixels

      Constructor for the GUI class.

        public GUI()

    • Method Detail

      • applyExistingSettings

        public void applyExistingSettings()
        Applies the settings. That is, updates the components in the Settings menu to reflect the actual state.

      • createButtonPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel createButtonPanel()
        Creates the JPanel which contains the buttons in the bottom of the GUI
        Returns:
        A JPanel containing some buttons to control the game

      • createGameBoard

        public static void createGameBoard()
        Starts the game.

      • createOptionsMenu

        public javax.swing.JFrame createOptionsMenu()
        Creates the JFrame which represents the Options...-menu.
        Returns:
        A JFrame representing the Options...-menu.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
        Changes the game speed
        Parameters:
        speed - The new speed of the game. 0 <= speed <= 4
